summary.long: Habakkuk is a book of the Old Testament.

verses.text: The pronouncement which Habakkuk the prophet saw:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How long, Lord, have I called for help,
And You do not hear?
I cry out to You, “Violence!”
Yet You do not save.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why do You make me see disaster,
And make me look at destitution?
Yes, devastation and violence are before me;
Strife exists and contention arises.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore the Law is ignored,
And justice is never upheld.
For the wicked surround the righteous;
Therefore justice comes out confused.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Look among the nations! Watch!
Be horrified! Be frightened speechless!
For I am accomplishing a work in your days—
You would not believe it even if you were told!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For behold, I am raising up the Chaldeans,
That grim and impetuous people
Who march throughout the earth,
To take possession of dwelling places that are not theirs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They are terrifying and feared;
Their justice and authority originate with themselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their horses are faster than leopards,
And quicker than wolves in the evening.
Their horsemen charge along,
Their horsemen come from afar;
They fly like an eagle swooping down to devour.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All of them come for violence.
Their horde of faces moves forward.
They gather captives like sand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They make fun of kings,
And dignitaries are an object of laughter to them.
They laugh at every fortress,
Then heap up dirt and capture it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then they fly along like the wind and pass on.
But they will be held guilty,
They whose strength is their god.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Are You not from time everlasting,
Lord, my God, my Holy One?
We will not die.
You, Lord, have appointed them to deliver judgment;
And You, O Rock, have destined them to punish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your eyes are too pure to look at evil,
And You cannot look at harm favorably.
Why do You look favorably
At those who deal treacherously?
Why are You silent when the wicked swallow up
Those more righteous than they?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why have You made people like the fish of the sea,
Like crawling things that have no ruler over them?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Chaldeans bring all of them up with a hook,
Drag them away with their net,
And gather them together in their fishing net.
Therefore they rejoice and are joyful.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore they offer a sacrifice to their net
And burn incense to their fishing net,
Because through these things their catch is large,
And their food is plentiful.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Will they therefore empty their net,
And continually slay nations without sparing?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will stand at my guard post
And station myself on the watchtower;
And I will keep watch to see what He will say to me,
And how I may reply when I am reprimanded.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then the Lord answered me and said,
“Write down the vision
And inscribe it clearly on tablets,
So that one who reads it may run.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Furthermore, wine betrays an arrogant man,
So that he does not achieve his objective.
He enlarges his appetite like Sheol,
And he is like death, never satisfied.
He also gathers to himself all the nations
And collects to himself all the peoples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Will all of these not take up a song of ridicule against him,
Even a saying and insinuations against him
And say, ‘Woe to him who increases what is not his—
For how long—
And makes himself rich with debts!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Will your creditors not rise up suddenly,
And those who collect from you awaken?
Indeed, you will become plunder for them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Since you have looted many nations,
All the rest of the peoples will loot you—
Because of human bloodshed and violence done to the land,
To the town and all its inhabitants.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Woe to him who makes evil profit for his household,
To put his nest on high,
To be saved from the hand of catastrophe!
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
For the stone will cry out from the wall,
And the rafter will answer it from the framework.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Woe to him who builds a city with bloodshed,
And founds a town with violence!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Is it not indeed from the Lord of armies
That peoples labor merely for fire,
And nations become weary for nothing?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the earth will be filled
With the knowledge of the glory of the Lord,
As the waters cover the sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
You will be filled with disgrace rather than honor.
Drink, you yourself, and expose your own foreskin!
The cup in the Lord’s right hand will come around to you,
And utter disgrace will come upon your glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the violence done to Lebanon will overwhelm you,
And the devastation of its animals by which you terrified them,
Because of human bloodshed and violence done to the land,
To the town and all its inhabitants.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“What benefit is a carved image when its maker has carved it,
Or a cast metal image, a teacher of falsehood?
For its maker trusts in his own handiwork
When he fashions speechless idols.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Woe to him who says to a piece of wood, ‘Awake!’
To a mute stone, ‘Arise!’
That is your teacher?
Behold, it is overlaid with gold and silver,
Yet there is no breath at all inside it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But the Lord is in His holy temple.
Let all the earth be silent before Him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A prayer of Habakkuk the prophet, according to Shigionoth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Lord, I have heard the report about You, and I was afraid.
Lord, revive Your work in the midst of the years,
In the midst of the years make it known.
In anger remember mercy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
God comes from Teman,
And the Holy One from Mount Paran. Selah
His splendor covers the heavens,
And the earth is full of His praise.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Before Him goes plague,
And plague comes forth after Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He stood and caused the earth to shudder;
He looked and caused the nations to jump.
Yes, the everlasting mountains were shattered,
The ancient hills collapsed.
His paths are everlasting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I saw the tents of Cushan under distress,
The tent curtains of the land of Midian were trembling.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Did the Lord rage against the rivers,
Or was Your anger against the rivers,
Or was Your rage against the sea,
That You rode on Your horses,
On Your chariots of salvation?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You removed Your bow from its holder,
The arrows of Your word were sworn. Selah
You divided the earth with rivers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The mountains saw You and quaked;
The downpour of waters swept by.
The deep raised its voice,
It lifted high its hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
In indignation You marched through the earth;
In anger You trampled the nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You went forth for the salvation of Your people,
For the salvation of Your anointed.
You smashed the head of the house of evil
To uncover him from foot to neck. Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You pierced with his own arrows
The head of his leaders.
They stormed in to scatter us;
Their arrogance was like those
Who devour the oppressed in secret.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You trampled on the sea with Your horses,
On the foam of many waters.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Even if the fig tree does not blossom,
And there is no fruit on the vines,
If the yield of the olive fails,
And the fields produce no food,
Even if the flock disappears from the fold,
And there are no cattle in the stalls,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yet I will triumph in the Lord,
I will rejoice in the God of my salvation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord God is my strength,
And He has made my feet like deer’s feet,
And has me walk on my high places.
For the choir director, on my stringed instruments.
verses.speaker: Narrator
